articles.title: Mississippi sheriff: 2 bodies discovered along rural road
articles.description: LAMAR, Miss. (AP) — Two bodies were discovered Wednesday afternoon by a group of people riding four-wheelers along a rural north Mississippi road, authorities confirmed.
articles.content:
LAMAR, Miss. (AP) Two bodies were discovered Wednesday afternoon by a group of people riding four-wheelers along a rural north Mississippi road, authorities confirmed.

articles.title: Li Tie replaces Lippi as China men's coach
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — Former Everton and Sheffield United midfielder Li Tie was hired Thursday as coach of China's national soccer team, replacing Marcello Lippi.
articles.content:
BEIJING (AP) Former Everton and Sheffield United midfielder Li Tie was hired Thursday as coach of China's national soccer team, replacing Marcello Lippi.

articles.title: Egyptian journalist says his home raided, brother arrested
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — An Egyptian journalist known for his critical views of the government said on Thursday that police raided his parents' house the previous night and arrested his brother.
articles.content:
CAIRO (AP) An Egyptian journalist known for his critical views of the government said on Thursday that police raided his parents' house the previous night and arrested his brother.

articles.title: Alabama sheriff identifies body of missing man found in lake
articles.description: GUNTERSVILLE, Ala. (AP) — Alabama authorities have identified the body of a missing man who was pulled from Lake Guntersville on Monday.
articles.content:
GUNTERSVILLE, Ala. (AP) Alabama authorities have identified the body of a missing man who was pulled from Lake Guntersville on Monday.

articles.description: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) — South Carolina's Department of Natural Resources is calling for citizens to recycle used oyster shells and discarded Christmas trees through programs aimed at boosting estuary health and promoting growth of marine life.

articles.title: Turkey probes how Nissan chief Ghosn fled via Istanbul
articles.description: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Turkish authorities are investigating possible security flaws that allowed former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn to skip bail in Japan and flee to Lebanon via Istanbul, Turkish media reported Thursday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Floods in Indonesia capital kill 17, force thousands to flee
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Severe flooding and landslides triggered by torrential rain in Indonesia's capital have killed 17 people and displaced tens of thousands, a disaster official said Thursday.

articles.title: Man falls onto DC Metro tracks, causes delays
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — An apparently intoxicated man fell onto the tracks of a Washington, D.C., Metro station, causing some of the first delays of the new year, according to authorities.

articles.description: ARLINGTON, Va. (AP) — A man sought in a Maryland jewelry store robbery has been arrested and charged in a bank robbery in Virginia.
